lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project dialog first)
1. Set up the correct JDK version, as follows:
1. Click `Configure` > `Structure for New Projects` and then `Project Settings` > `Project` > `Project SDK`
1. If JDK 11 is listed in the drop down, select it. If it is not, click `New...` and select the directory where you installed JDK 11
1. Import the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.

1. After the importing is complete, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()`. If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below:
Message in round brackets are explanations, no need to type in when using Duke.
Use the # symbol to indicate number
### `todo` - Add Todo tasks into the list
This command adds Todo task into the list
`Now you have # tasks in the list.`
### `deadline` - Add Deadline tasks into the list
This command adds Deadline task into the list,
accept dates in a format such as yyyy-mm-dd format (e.g., 2020-10-15)
and print in a different format such as MMM dd yyyy e.g., (Oct 15 2020).
`Now you have # tasks in the list.`
### `event` - Add Event tasks into the list
This command adds Event task into the list,
accept dates in a format such as yyyy-mm-dd format (e.g., 2020-10-15)
and print in a different format such as MMM dd yyyy e.g., (Oct 15 2020).
`Now you have # tasks in the list.`
This command marks the task at position `#(task_index)` as done
`Nice! I've marked this task as done:`
This command marks the task at position `#(task_index)` as undone
`Noted! I've marked this task as undone:`
### `delete` - delete the task user want to remove
This command deletes the task at position `#(task_index)`
`Now you have # tasks in the list.`
### `find` - find the task with the keyword
This command finds tasks that contain `keyword`
`Here are the matching tasks in your list:`
This command remove all tasks in the list
`Good job! You have finished all tasks in the list`
This command group all tasks in Todo-Deadline-Event order.
In other words, tasks in the list will be rearranged,
and Todo tasks in the first part,
Deadline tasks in the second part,
Event tasks in the last part.
`Got it. I have group tasks in the Todo-Deadline-Event order`
`Here are the tasks in your list:`
This command prints the help list
`Here is the Help List (words in round brackets are explanations no need to type)`
`1.  add command: you can add three types of tasks by following these format`
`ii)  Deadline task: deadline xxxx(task description) /by yyyy-mm-dd`
`iii) Event task: event xxxx(task description) /at yyyy-mm-dd`
`10. restore command: you can list all removed tasks in the backupList by following this format`
This command list all tasks in the list
`Here are the tasks in your list:`
This command list all tasks in the backupList which contains all deleted tasks,
this command will not store any deleted tasks into list
`Here are all tasks you have removed:`
This command prints bye message and terminate the program
`Bye. Hope to see you again soon!`
* Duke program stores Todo Deadline and Event three types of tasks
* Taskslist is used for storing tasks inside program e.g., [T][✓] a
* Textlist is used for storing tasks inside TXT file e.g., T - 1 - a
* This method makes use of getFileContents to load tasks from the file
* and saving tasks in the file by using writeToFile method
* Run the whole program by using Commands method
ArrayList<Task> tasks = new ArrayList<>();      // store tasks the user is adding
ArrayList<String> texts = new ArrayList<>();    // store text format of each task
ArrayList<Task> backupList = new ArrayList<>(); // store tasks removed by the user
// if the user say bye then exit become true
System.out.println("     ☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");

* @param texts  ArrayList of tasks in the TXT format
* @param words  Words the user typed in

* and shows current amount of tasks in the list
* @param amount  Number of tasks in the list currently
public static void printMessage (Task t, int amount) {

System.out.println("     Now you have " + amount + " tasks in the list.");

* HelpCommand program prints the help list
* This method prints the help list
System.out.println("     Here is the Help List (words in round brackets are explanations no need to type)\n");
System.out.println("        1.  add command: you can add three types of tasks by following these format");
System.out.println("            i)   Todo task: todo xxxx(task description)");
System.out.println("            ii)  Deadline task: deadline xxxx(task description) /by yyyy-mm-dd");
System.out.println("            iii) Event task: event xxxx(task description) /at yyyy-mm-dd\n");
System.out.println("        2.  delete command: you can remove any task in the list by following this format");
System.out.println("            e.g. delete 1 (the first task in the will be deleted)\n");
System.out.println("        3.  do command: you can mark any task as done by following this format");
System.out.println("            e.g. done 1 (the first task in the will be done)\n");
System.out.println("        4.  undo command: you can mark any task as undone by following this format");
System.out.println("            e.g. undone 1 (the first task in the will be done)\n");
System.out.println("        5.  find command: you can find any task in the list by following this format");
System.out.println("            e.g. find xxxx (the tasks that contain the keyword xxxx will be listed)\n");
System.out.println("        6.  help command: you can ask me to print the help lis by following this format");
System.out.println("        7.  list command: you can list all tasks in the list by following this format");
System.out.println("        8.  group command: you can group all tasks in the list by following this format");
System.out.println("        9.  clear command: you can clear all tasks in the list by following this format");
System.out.println("        10. restore command: you can list all removed tasks in the backupList by following this format");
